channel.title: talk on Keisha S Perkins
channel.description: Recent content in talk on Keisha S Perkins

item.title: Learn Programming with Automation Apps
item.description: We’re in the age of STEM right now and everyone is screaming that “Everyone should learn to code” when what they really mean is that more people should learn how to program. Programming is a skill that will help most of us, as most of us deal with computers on a daily basis. Programmatic Thinking is a skill that will help almost anyone, because programmitic thinking is just problem solving in a systematic way.

item.title: Up and Running With HUGO
item.description: I spoke at Baton Rouge Hack Night about my favorite static site generator, HUGO. Hugo is a great static site generator that's super fast and lightweight. This talk demos the steps for getting a site up and running, adding a few posts, and choosing a theme. I really recommend digging into the HUGO docs as well as the HUGO Community Forum for more in-depth explanations of how to use HUGO for your own site.

item.title: How One .PSD File Transformed My Workflow
item.description: I create a good deal of media for my church, and sometimes that media needs to be used in many ways. Perhaps the event flier that I create for a pre-service loop of slides needs to also be made to fit social media, or be printed and handed out. Up until recently I solved this issue by first designing something for the church’s presentation screen at a 16:9 ratio, then resizing and tweaking the design to meet whatever other needs where given to me.
